channel.title: Straw News
channel.description: News about Straw, the GNOME feed reader

item.title: Straw 0.27 Released
item.description:
• Added hooks to NetworkManager to detect network status
  • Support for feed enclosures (Leandro Lameiro)
  • Improved key shortcuts (Andrew Conkling)
  • Fixed close button bug in the About dialog (Wouter Bolsterlee)
  • Added button to find tab to go to back to main view (Leandro Lameiro)
  • Use stock icons for connect and disconnect
  • Set default browser to empty instead of empty string in GCONF schemas (Leandro Lameiro)
  • Bugfixes by Ryan P Skadberg
  • New Arabic and Dzongkha translations (GNOME i18n Team)
  • Updated translations by the GNOME i18n Team

item.title: Straw 0.26 Released
item.description:
Straw is back and we have a new release! Changes include:
  • Minimum dependency on Python2.4 and PyGTK 2.4.
  • Autoloading of feed content on feed selection.
  • DBus support (Subscribe to feed)
  • More usable find dialog.
  • Clipboard copy and text magnification content view.
  • FeedParser 4.1.
  • Feed sorting in the feed list view.
  • Marking all feeds as read.
  • Bugfixes and cleanups.

item.title: FedoraCore 3 Package
item.description:
Straw can be found in the 'extras' repository. Instructions can be found at http://download.fedora.redhat.com/pub/fedora/linux/extras/readme.extras.
Thanks to Adrian's bug report.

item.title: Change of maintainer
item.description: Juri Pakaste is stepping aside as the maintainer of Straw. Jan Alonzo will take over the job.

item.title: Straw 0.25.1 released
item.description: • Fix a regression in installations where ADNS available, now it works right again

item.title: Straw 0.25 released
item.description:
• Major speedups in feed parsing and feed information updating
  • Show startup notification, show the main window earlier, make the startup faster
  • Improved article view, also focusable again
  • Updated translations
  • Some more locale/encoding problems fixed
  • Make sure pygtk is always initialized correctly

item.title: Straw 0.24 released
item.description:
• Remote OPML subscriptions for categories.
  • Half-asynchronous subscribe process.
  • Configuration and installation fixes.
  • FeedParser 3.2
  • Notification area applet, displayed when there are unread items.
  • Locale handling fixes.
  • Nicer article header.
  • Display feed link in article header, move the old feed information display to the feed properties dialog.
  • Bug fixes, small UI improvements.

item.title: Straw 0.23 released
item.description:
• Per-subscription settings for refresh frequency and number of articles stored
  • UI improvements and bug fixes

item.title: Straw 0.22.1 released
item.description:
• Fixes in entity conversion and title slicing
  • Don't check for the existence of mxDateTime in setup.py

item.title: Straw 0.22 released
item.description:
• Categories
  • Drop mxDateTime dependency: you still need it the first time you run this version with an old db, but not after that: see README for information about the conversion and the dangers
  • Authentication challenge in the subscription druid
  • Various UI improvements
  • Use Python distutils instead of a Makefile
  • Probably some bug fixes too!

item.title: Straw 0.21.2 released
item.description:
• Proper installation of the schema (GConf)
  • Feed information setting in GConf
  • Dutch translation
  • Various bug fixes and updated .no translation

item.title: Straw 0.21.1 released
item.description: • Fix a bug in feed information display

item.title: Straw 0.21 released
item.description:
• Somewhat improved main window layout and keyboard navigation
  • Context menu in the subscriptions list
  • Feed properties dialog
  • Refactored code
  • Fixed problems with some broken http implementations
  • Update the default subscriptions to include the footnotes feed with the full items
  • Remove totally useless blogroll/subscriptions list support
  • Bug fixes

item.title: Straw 0.20 released
item.description:
• Atom support
  • Reduced memory consumption
  • Eliminated the worst freezes in the UI
  • Switched completely over to Mark Pilgrim's FeedParser, no longer two separate parsers
  • Improved the UI a bit
  • Fix bugs with mixed up feeds
  • Live with slightly broken HTTP servers that use just LF as a header separator
  • Reduced dependencies: no more need for PyXML, make ADNS optional
  • No more HTML in Article list
  • SubscribeDialog is now a GNOME Druid
  • Dragging of URLs from browsers now works
  • Move configuration stuff to gconf
  • Change timings and number of connections, should be faster now
  • Various bug fixes

item.title: Straw 0.19.2 released
item.description:
• Fixed bug that makes straw not quit properly
  • Fixed HTML character entity conversion
  • Strip HTML tags in feed description
  • Minor Bugfixes

item.title: Straw 0.19.1 released
item.description: Bah, missed the online/offline images again, somehow. This release fixes that. And one bug.

item.title: Straw 0.19 released
item.description:
• We're alive!
  • Show a warning dialog if the user tries to poll when offline
  • Remember the positions of the panes in the main window
  • Try to fix the item list column size problem a bit
  • Prettify the item display
  • Some support for the PRISM namespace
  • necho support
  • We don't use threads anymore
  • Works with Berkeley DB 4
  • Dashboard front end
  • Use the gnome_href widget in feed information view
  • Read dublin core creator from channel
  • Connection timing out now works independently of something arriving down the wire
  • Display cogwheels next to feeds being actively polled
  • Commands for navigating between feeds
  • Automatically change a feed's location when the server sends a 301
  • Updated translation for French, new, probably already outdated translations for Norweigian and Russian - guys, sorry for being so slow
  • Plenty of bugfixes, probably plenty of new bugs

item.title: Straw mailing lists
item.description: There are now two mailing lists for Straw: straw-devel for development discussions and straw-commits which gets all the CVS commit messages. See the Straw project page for details.

item.title: Straw 0.18.1 released
item.description: Oops. Forgot to include the online/offline images in 0.18. This time they are in the package. Honest.

item.title: Straw 0.18 released
item.description:
• Ability to import subscriptions in OPML format
  • A list of default subscriptions (in OPML format)
  • Autosize the item list columns so the Keep toggles won't drift to the right
  • Fix the browse button in feed information view
  • Fix the blogroll subscriptions stuff, it was apparently broken since 0.16
  • Fix dealing with invalid HTTP status lines
  • Proxy support: read proxy information from GConf, and if not found there, from the environment variable http_proxy. If a proxy is being used, don't look up other host names.
  • Support all(?) HTML entities in item titles
  • Add an offline mode, switchable in the UI (thanks to the makers of Evolution for online/offline icons), or on the command line (--offline)
  • Deal better with broken DNS records
  • Deal with redirects not containing a full URI
  • Make feed sorting work if only one feed is selected
  • Clean up error display: don't show exception memory location junk or the errno in case of socket.error
  • Fix main window size remembering
  • Add some unit tests

item.title: Straw 0.17 released
item.description:
• Remove the bogus Referer option
  • Items can be marked to be on hold, that is, non-expirable
  • Make dialogs more dialogey: they are now transient and will be called to front when displayed
  • The preferences dialog now allows the selection of and operations on multiple feeds
  • Send a Referer header pointing to the RSS file when fetching images
  • Don't report parsing failure on status 304
  • Added French translation

item.title: Straw 0.16 released
item.description:
Major delay in the release of 0.16 was caused by a nearly complete reworking of the network layer of Straw. The new release should be stabler and more responsive.
Please note that the new version adds more dependencies: you now need the ADNS library and the corresponding Python binding.
New stuff:
  • Asynchronous networking instead of synchronous networking in a thread.
  • Show a broken image symbol if there was a problem fetching the image. While waiting for an image to get downloaded, a waiting symbol is displayed.
  • Fixed about box, now it can be displayed multiple times per session.
  • Added German translation.
  • Improved error reporting: no more exception spew to stdout/err, try to show all the errors in the feed view and show error icons in the feed list. Store errors with feed information.
  • Don't re-fetch blogroll/subscriptions every time the user asks for them, only after polling
  • Find works now for freshmeat information, too
  • Save and load the main window size
  • Workaround for the broken gettext in Python < 2.2.2(?)
  • Cleaned up the code

item.title: Straw 0.15 released
item.description:
• Fix a problem with web servers which don't support If-None-Match
  • Create links to Creative Commons licenses
  • Save more data from articles: Freshmeat stuff, Dublin Core creator, Creative Commons licenses
  • Previous/Next now wrap around the feed list
  • Fix a problem with sessions
  • Deal with entities in titles so they aren't displayed in the item list
  • Minimize horizontal space usage by feed list columns after adding/removing feeds
  • Filter out font tags in item descriptions
  • Minor fixes

item.title: Straw 0.14 released
item.description:
• Internationalization support
  • Preliminary Finnish translations
  • Strip URLs to avoid broken links
  • Fix find so it won't break after multiple searches with no hits
  • Make the find dialog a real dialog which appears where mouse cursor is, and make the text field grab keyboard focus when the dialog is displayed
  • Clean up the main window interface a bit

item.title: Straw 0.13.2 released
item.description:
• Recognize RSS 0.9 namespace, fixes problems with at least mail-archive.com feeds
  • Accept gzipped content
  • Really disable the subscriptions / blogrolls menu item when there's nothing available

item.title: Straw now in Debian unstable
item.description: Straw is now in Debian unstable! apt-get install straw and no need to worry about dependencies any more. A big thanks to Ross.

item.title: Straw 0.13.1 released
item.description: 0.13 introduced a small bug to handling of broken RSS, fix that

item.title: Straw 0.13 released
item.description:
• Fixes to db handling: checkpoint, destroy unneeded logfiles, put smaller limits to log size. Disk space usage should be better under control now.
  • Remove the separate RSS URL field from subscribe tool, it's not needed - you can type the RSS url into the news site location field if you want.
  • Accept url drags from browsers etc in the main window.
  • Fix problems with extra whitespace here and there: just remove it when parsing.
  • Fix more character set problems.
  • Add a bit of CSS to item display, to show q elements better.
  • Disable subscriptions / blogrolls menu item when a feed without either is selected.

item.title: Straw 0.12 released
item.description:
• Export subscriptions list as OPML
  • Use ETag/If-None-Match HTTP headers to reduce bandwidth usage
  • Fix character set problems
  • Fix search regression
  • Rename subscriptions/blogrolls browsing, only make it active on feeds that have one of them
  • Try to parse XML with Expat even if there is no <?xml ... declaration
  • Look for images in content:encoded if it exists
  • New version of rssparser.py
  • Makefile commands and install prefix overrideable by environment variables

item.title: Straw 0.11 released
item.description:
• Support for most of blogChannel module in the UI: see menu item Go/Subscriptions and blogrolls
  • RSS 1.0 and RSS 0.9x/2.0 support are now equal. Straw now supports content:encoded, freshmeat namespace, blogChannel namespace, and some more of Dublin Core
  • Convert UTF-8 entities to characters in item titles for the item list
  • Don't show empty items
  • After finding a feed, save its items so another poll won't be needed
  • Added an icon
  • Added a .desktop file so Straw will show up in menus
  • Install to the GNOME installation directory

item.title: Straw 0.10.2 Released
item.description: Fix keyboard item navigation

item.title: Straw 0.10.1 Released
item.description: Less broken and more responsive search, search button in toolbar, read and display RSS 1.0 content:encoding, work around empty items in storage

item.title: Straw 0.10 Released
item.description: Incremental search for items, number of unread displayed in title bar, alphabetical sort for feeds.

item.title: Straw 0.9.4 Released
item.description: More DB fixes, some fixes to the adding of items to feeds, cosmetic UI fixes.

item.title: Straw 0.9.3 Released
item.description: Another fix for potential DB corruption

item.title: Straw 0.9.2 Released
item.description: Lots of little UI fixes, a DB corruption fix

item.title: Straw has moved
item.description: Straw's new home page is hosted at freesoftware.fsf.org. The news feed can be found here<.

item.title: Straw 0.9.1 Released
item.description: Quick-fix for a bug in preferences dialog.

item.title: Straw 0.9 Released
item.description: Straw 0.9 has been released. There are some notable UI improvements: a fancy subscriber tool, a channel information display and some sorely needed speed.

item.title: Straw 0.8 Released
item.description: Straw 0.8 has been released. It includes a more liberal RSS parser, RSS quality feedback, referer headers for RSS fetching, timeouting sockets, plus the obligatory bug fixes and small UI improvements.

item.title: Straw 0.7 Released
item.description: Straw 0.7 has been released. This version features local storage of items and images, some UI improvements and bug fixes.
